text:
Hi, is this expected behavior? Julia 1.5.3
```julia> data = fill(1f0,1,1)
1×1 Array{Float32,2}:
 1.0

julia> T = Float32
Float32

julia> Matrix{Union{Missing, T}}(data)
1×1 Array{Union{Missing, Float32},2}:
 1.0f0
julia> Matrix{Union{Missing, T}}(data) .- 3
1×1 Array{Float32,2}:
 -2.0```
I would expect arithmetic operations to have same output as input, so I'm a bit surprised by this behavior

elements.text: Hi, is this expected behavior? Julia 1.5.3

text:
Well, I would expect the output of the operation to be
```1×1 Array{Union{Missing, Float32},2}:
 -2.0f0```
not
```1×1 Array{Float32,2}:
 -2.0```

elements.text: Well, I would expect the output of the operation to be

text: I think that when you broadcast you get the smallest container that can contain the output. No problem when you do stuff in-place (common with broadcasting)
